slovak.apSub1: Už Starý zákon svedčí o Ježišovi Kristovi
slovak.apVerse1: Určili mu teda deň a zišlo sa ich mnoho na jeho byte. (Pavel) im od rána až do večera vykladal, svedčil o kráľovstve Božom a presviedčal ich o Ježišovi z Mojžišovho Zákona a z Prorokov.
slovak.apVerse2: Čo bolo od počiatku, čo sme počuli, čo sme videli na vlastné oči, na čo sme pozerali a čoho sa nám dotýkali ruky, (o tom svedčíme, totiž) o Slove života. A ten život sa zjavil, my sme (Ho) videli, svedčíme (o Ňom) a zvestujeme vám večný život, ktorý bol u Otca a zjavil sa nám. Čo sme (teda) videli a počuli, zvestujeme aj vám, aby ste aj vy mali spoločenstvo s nami. Naše spoločenstvo aby bolo s Otcom a s Jeho Synom Ježišom Kristom. Toto vám píšeme, aby naša radosť bola úplná.
slovak.apText1: Apoštoli svedčili o Ježišovi, ktorého fyzicky videli, poznali, ktorého stretli po Jeho smrti a ktorého videli ako je unášaný do neba.
slovak.apVerse3: Tohto Ježiša vzkriesil Boh a my všetci sme svedkami toho.
slovak.apVerse4: Ale zamordovali ste Vodcu života, ktorého Boh vzkriesil z mŕtvych; a my sme svedkami toho.
slovak.apVerse5: Vedzte teda vy všetci, aj všetok ľud izraelský, že tento človek stojí pred vami zdravý v mene Ježiša Krista Nazaretského, ktorého ste vy ukrižovali, ale Boh Ho vzkriesil z mŕtvych.
slovak.apVerse6: Apoštolovia však veľmi mocne vydávali svedectvo o vzkriesení Pána Ježiša a veľká milosť spočinula na nich na všetkých.
slovak.apVerse7: Boh našich otcov vzkriesil Ježiša, ktorého ste vy zamordovali, keď ste Ho povesili na drevo. Toho Boh povýšil svojou pravicou za Vodcu a Spasiteľa, aby dal Izraelovi pokánie a odpustenie hriechov. A svedkami toho sme my a Duch Svätý, ktorého dal Boh tým, čo Ho poslúchajú.
slovak.apVerse8: Ale neprestali deň čo deň učiť v chráme a po domoch a zvestovať evanjelium Krista Ježiša.
slovak.apVerse9: A my sme svedkami všetkého, čo činil v Judsku a v Jeruzaleme, ako Ho aj zamordovali, povesiac Ho na drevo. Toho Boh vzkriesil v tretí deň a dal Mu zjavovať sa.
slovak.apVerse10: Až na jediný výkrik, ktorý som zavolal, stojac medzi nimi: Pre vzkriesenie z mŕtvych ma dnes súdite.
slovak.apText2: Pavol bol súdený a bitý preto, že svedčil o vzkriesenom Ježišovi Kristovi.
slovak.apSub3: Svedčili o pokání skrze vieru v Ježiša Krista
slovak.apVerse11: Riekol im: Tak je napísané, že Kristus musel trpieť a na tretí deň vstať z mŕtvych a že sa musí kázať v Jeho mene pokánie na odpustenie hriechov všetkým národom, počnúc od Jeruzalema.
slovak.apSub4: Svedčili o kráľovstve Božom, do ktorého vstúpi človek len skrze vieru v Ježiša Krista
slovak.apVerse12: A celkom smelo a bez prekážky kázal o kráľovstve Božom a učil o Pánovi Ježišovi Kristovi.
slovak.apVerse13: Amen, amen, hovorím ti: Ak sa niekto nenarodí z vody a z Ducha, nemôže vojsť do Božieho kráľovstva. Na to mu Nikodém odpovedal: „Ako sa to môže stať?“ A ako Mojžiš vyzdvihol hada na púšti, tak musí byť vyzdvihnutý aj Syn človeka, aby každý, kto v neho verí, mal večný život.
slovak.apText3: Kázanie o kráľovstve je opäť len kázanie o Ježišovi Kristovi.
slovak.apVerse14: S mužmi, ktorí životy nasadili pre meno nášho Pána Ježiša Krista.
slovak.apText4: Tak zvestovali evanjelium, že riskovali vlastné životy za svedectvo o Pánovi Ježišovi.
slovak.apVerse15: Ale niektorí z nich boli z Cypru a z Kyrény, a keď prišli do Antiochie, hovorili aj Grékom a zvestovali Pána Ježiša.
slovak.apVerse16: Predvolali si ich teda a prikázali im, aby nikdy viac ani nehovorili ani neučili v mene Ježišovom.
slovak.apText5: Čo teda vadilo ich protivníkom? Meno Ježiš.
slovak.apSub6: Svedčili o tom, čo hovoril Ježiš Kristus
slovak.apText6: Slovo, ktoré hlásal Pán Ježiš, to hlásali apoštoli.
slovak.apVerse17: O niekoľko dní povedal Pavel Barnabášovi: Vráťme sa a po všetkých mestách, v ktorých sme zvestovali slovo Pánovo, ponavštevujeme bratov, ako sa majú.
slovak.apVerse18: Ale prijmite moc Ducha Svätého, ktorý zostúpi na vás, a budete mi svedkami.
slovak.apText7: Apoštoli nehlásali evanjelium rutinným a rozumovým rozprávaním o tom, čo videli, ale v moci Ducha Svätého.
slovak.apVerse19: Veď ja sa nehanbím za evanjelium (Kristovo): lebo mocou Božou je ono na spasenie každému veriacemu, najprv Židovi, a aj Grékovi.
slovak.apText8: Spasenie hriešnika je možné len skrze vieru v Ježiša Krista a poslušnosti Jeho Slovu.
slovak.apVerse20: Zjavuje sa v ňom zaiste spravodlivosť Božia z viery pre vieru, ako je napísané: Spravodlivý z viery bude žiť.
slovak.apText9: Vo viere vo vzkriesenie a v nasledovaní Ježiša Krista sa zjavuje Božia spravodlivosť.
slovak.apSub9: Nehlásať vzkriesenie je porušením Božieho nariadenia
slovak.apVerse21: Veď Boh, ktorému slúžim svojím duchom zvesťou evanjelia Jeho Syna, je mi svedkom, ako neprestajne spomínam na vás.
slovak.apText10: Pavol slúži Bohu tým, že zvestuje evanjelium Jeho Syna. Ak by učeníci nehlásali to, čoho boli očitými svedkami, porušili by príkaz Boha.
slovak.apVerse22: Ale Peter a Ján odpovedali im takto: Súďte, či je spravodlivé pred Bohom poslúchať viac vás ako Boha! Lebo my nemôžeme nehovoriť o tom, čo sme videli a počuli.
slovak.apVerse23: Čudujem sa, že od Toho, ktorý vás povolal v milosti Kristovej, sa tak rýchlo odvraciate k inému evanjeliu, ktoré ani nie je iné evanjelium. Sú však niektorí, čo robia zmätok medzi vami a chcú prekrútiť evanjelium Kristovo. Ale keby sme aj my, alebo keby vám anjel z neba zvestoval (iné) evanjelium miesto toho, ktoré sme vám my zvestovali, - nech je prekliaty! Ako sme prv povedali, aj teraz znovu hovorím: ak vám niekto zvestuje (iné) evanjelium miesto toho, ktoré ste prijali, - nech je prekliaty!

english.apSub1: The Old Testament already testifies about Jesus Christ
english.apVerse1: So they set a day to meet with Paul, and many people came to the place he was staying. He expounded to them from morning to evening, testifying about the kingdom of God and persuading them about Jesus from the Law of Moses and the Prophets.
english.apVerse2: That which was from the beginning, which we have heard, which we have seen with our own eyes, which we have gazed upon and touched with our own hands - this is the Word of life. And this is the life that was revealed; we have seen it and testified to it, and we proclaim to you the eternal life that was with the Father and was revealed to us. We proclaim to you what we have seen and heard, so that you also may have fellowship with us. And this fellowship of ours is with the Father and with His Son, Jesus Christ. We write these things so that our joy may be complete.
english.apText1: The apostles testified about Jesus, Whom they physically saw, knew, met after His death, and Whom they saw taken up into heaven.
english.apSub2: They testified about the resurrection of Jesus Christ
english.apVerse3: God has raised this Jesus to life, to which we are all witnesses.
english.apVerse4: You killed the Author of life, but God raised Him from the dead, and we are witnesses of the fact.
english.apVerse5: Then let this be known to all of you and to all the people of Israel: It is by the name of Jesus Christ of Nazareth, whom you crucified but whom God raised.
english.apVerse6: With great power the apostles continued to give their testimony about the resurrection of the Lord Jesus. And abundant grace was upon them all.
english.apVerse7: The God of our fathers raised up Jesus, whom you had killed by hanging Him on a tree. God exalted Him to His right hand as Prince and Savior, in order to grant repentance and forgiveness of sins to Israel. We are witnesses of these things, and so is the Holy Spirit, whom God has given to those who obey Him.
english.apVerse8: Every day, in the temple courts and from house to house, they did not stop teaching and proclaiming the good news that Jesus is the Christ.
english.apVerse9: We are witnesses of all that He did, both in the land of the Jews and in Jerusalem. And although they put Him to death by hanging Him on a tree, God raised Him up on the third day and caused Him to be seen
english.apVerse10: Unless it was this one thing I called out as I stood in their presence: ‘It is concerning the resurrection of the dead that I am on trial before you today.’
english.apText2: Paul was judged and beaten because he testified about the resurrected Jesus Christ.
english.apSub3: They testified about repentance through faith in Jesus Christ
english.apVerse11: And He told them, “This is what is written: The Christ will suffer and rise from the dead on the third day, and in His name repentance and forgiveness of sins will be proclaimed to all nations, beginning in Jerusalem.
english.apSub4: They testified about the kingdom of God, into which a person enters only through faith in Jesus Christ
english.apVerse12: Boldly and freely he proclaimed the kingdom of God and taught about the Lord Jesus Christ.
english.apVerse13: Truly, truly, I tell you, no one can enter the kingdom of God unless he is born of water and the Spirit. “How can this be?” Nicodemus asked. Just as Moses lifted up the snake in the wilderness, so the Son of Man must be lifted up, that everyone who believes in Him may have eternal life.
english.apText3: Preaching about the kingdom is again just preaching about Jesus Christ.
english.apSub5: They testified about the person of Jesus Christ
english.apVerse14: Men who have risked their lives for the name of our Lord Jesus Christ.
english.apText4: They preached the gospel in such a way that they risked their lives for the testimony of the Lord Jesus.
english.apVerse15: But some of them, men from Cyprus and Cyrene, went to Antioch and began speaking to the Greeks as well, proclaiming the good news about the Lord Jesus.
english.apVerse16: Then they called them in again and commanded them not to speak or teach at all in the name of Jesus.
english.apText5: So what bothered their opponents? The name of Jesus.
english.apSub6: They testified to what Jesus Christ said
english.apText6: The apostles preached the word that Jesus preached.
english.apVerse17: Some time later Paul said to Barnabas, “Let us go back and visit the brothers in every town where we proclaimed the word of the Lord, to see how they are doing.”
english.apSub7: How did the apostles preach the gospel?
english.apVerse18: But you will receive power when the Holy Spirit comes upon you, and you will be My witnesses.
english.apText7: The apostles did not preach the gospel by routine and rational narration of what they saw, but in the power of the Holy Spirit.
english.apSub8: What is the evidence of the true gospel?
english.apVerse19: I am not ashamed of the gospel, because it is the power of God for salvation to everyone who believes, first to the Jew, then to the Greek.
english.apText8: The salvation of a sinner is possible only through faith in Jesus Christ, which is manifested by obedience to His Word.
english.apVerse20: For the gospel reveals the righteousness of God that comes by faith from start to finish, just as it is written: “The righteous will live by faith.”
english.apText9: God's justice is revealed in faith in the resurrection and in following Jesus Christ.
english.apSub9: Not proclaiming the resurrection is a violation of God's command
english.apVerse21: God, whom I serve with my spirit  in preaching the gospel of His Son, is my witness how constantly I remember you.
english.apText10: Paul serves God by preaching the gospel of His Son. If the disciples did not proclaim what they had witnessed, they would have violated God's command.
english.apVerse22: But Peter and John replied, “Judge for yourselves whether it is right in God’s sight to listen to you rather than God. For we cannot stop speaking about what we have seen and heard.”
english.apVerse23: I am amazed how quickly you are deserting the One who called you by the grace of Christ and are turning to a different gospel - which is not even a gospel. Evidently some people are troubling you and trying to distort the gospel of Christ. But even if we or an angel from heaven should preach a gospel contrary to the one we preached to you, let him be under a curse! As we have said before, so now I say again: If anyone is preaching to you a gospel contrary to the one you received, let him be under a curse!
